page.title: 10Airfield Clubs
page.content: The Parachute Club at Weston-on-the- Green Airfield is essentially for leisure purposes by military personel but it is open to a few civilian members.They have two jump planes and operate most weekends and occasionally during the week in summertime.They log about 7,000 jumps per year and have about 250 members. The Gliding Club is the original Oxford Gliding Club which was reformed in 1951 on Kidlington Airfield but was forced to move when this was developed.It moved to Weston in 1956 and has 120 members.It operates only at weekends except for two summer weeks and has five club air- craft although many of the members bring their own aircraft for each days flying.The annual membership is #55 and an hours flight,including launch costs around #4.50.
